description.narrative:
ADOL#s #Promoting Women Rights in Abim District, Karamoja Sub-region# project intends to address the bride price induced women#s rights abuse, bride price which are normally paid to seal a marriage and address the ignorance about their rights and survival strategies. Although women they contribute to over 95% of the labour force in garden work, they are discriminated against in the equal sharing of household resources like land, harvest and sharing of incomes generated from crop production and other domestic activities. And so, there is need to for women to undertake human rights awareness activities to address the inequalities.
The project will train 80 women as community trainers in Gender Based Violence for improved service delivery and; will empower 2 Human Rights Activists# groups with skills to convey human rights and peace building messages to the communities through music, dance and drama. Training 80women as trainers in the observance, protection and promotion of human rights and gender-based violence. The 80 trainers will then train the rest of the other 550 women at community/household level; Conducting Music, Dance and Drama (MDD) in Human Rights and Gender Based Violence: 2 MDD groups facilitated with costumes and instruments to compose music, dance and drama on service delivery gapsand women rights.
